page.title: 01WELWYN GARDEN CITY
page.content: Situated in a{50}sqr mile area of countryside the Welwyn Hatfield district borders Greater London to the South and to the North encompasses rural Hertfordshire.In the centre of this district is Welwyn Garden City,a garden city,designed in the{1930s}by Ebeneezer Howard and Louis de Soissons.Although Hatfield to the South and Welwyn to the North are steeped in historical interest,prior to the{1930s}W.G.C was nothing but fields.Indeed the rural beginnings are retained as W.G.C has open spaces with trees and spaces of carefully maintained grass and flowers.Initially designed to be separate from the housing area,the industrial area caters for firms such as Nabisco and Roche.W.G.C is linked to London by electric trains to Kings Cross.Bus routes link local and distant places.
